intro: Cacalia angulata, commonly known as the angular cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are angular and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Cacalia angulata is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained environments.
